comments:
I am running the Eclipse3.2.0/WTP1.5.0 all in one package.

I created a Tomcat 5.0 server and then opened the server editor for this server.  I then change the host name field (or any other field) and save the change.  If I then change any field in the editor and try to save it again, I get the error.  It is necessary to close the server editor and reopen it again to make another modification (very unfriendly).

A Java stack of the failure follows:



org.eclipse.wst.server.ui SEVERE  22/09/06 09:41.35.293 Error saving server editor
org.eclipse.core.runtime.CoreException: Could not save because the file has been modified since the start of editting.
	at org.eclipse.wst.server.core.internal.WorkingCopyHelper.validateTimestamp(WorkingCopyHelper.java:116)
	at org.eclipse.wst.server.core.internal.ServerWorkingCopy.save(ServerWorkingCopy.java:297)

	at org.eclipse.jface.action.ActionContributionItem.access$2(ActionContributionItem.java:488)
	at org.eclipse.jface.action.ActionContributionItem$6.handleEvent(ActionContributionItem.java:441)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.EventTable.sendEvent(EventTable.java:66)

This was fixed in the 1.5.1 and 2.0 streams a month or two ago.
This is part of a "mass update" where bugs showing "fixed" between 7/1/2006 and 9/27/2006 are assumed fixed in WTP 1.5.1. feel free to change the target milestone if you know a more accurate setting.

I normally only download the all in one packages when they become available which is why I had not picked up this correction (they did not create an all in one for version 1.5.1).  I had searched both the bug reports and the mailing lists but did not find a mention of this problem so I submitted the bug report.

Based on your feedback I have downloaded version 1.5.1 (and all its dependent parts) and have verified that the problem does not exist in this version.

Thank you for the prompt response.

traces.message: Could not save because the file has been modified since the start of editting.
